Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel of design in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: DiegoNadia V
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights in this hotel in Berlin. If you are looking for something modern and with a touch of design this hotel is for you! Our medium room was not so big but don't be scared about that, the room space was wonderful organized and the bed was really HUGE! The best in which I have ever slept! In the room we found an iMac computer with which we could relax, listening to music and surfing the internet planning better our next days activities. The location is good, well connected with a metro station in the nearby and quiet also during the night. We would defenitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: jgdd
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were small by Berlin standards, even by NY standards. Very little space to unpack. There was no TV in the room, just an imac and given that we had a thunderstorm one day so came in to watch a film and the internet went down, we had nothing to do as there was no internet. You can't watch movies in the room either unless you have a German iTunes account or so it seemed to us. The hotel is really well located but the lobby gets noisy at night and often has parties on so it's not somewhere for a quiet break. Not bad but definitely better value in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Kisutazo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location and it's design is cool, although not very practical: the hangers (attached to the backside of our bed) kept falling down, the Apple desktop was a bit complicated to use, we couldn't really hang your wet towels, the doors to the floors work with your e-key, which is not good when you have a few big bags with you, etc. The roof top terrace has a nice view, but I would not spend much time there. The staff was nice, although "fogot" to tell us that the bikes we were to rent cost almost twice as much as normally...

Reviews.Title: “A funky 24 Hour Bar”
Reviews.Author: Dogsheep
Reviews.Content: Pretty faultless really, the bar is attached to the reception so yes it's 24 hour. We arrived to a party/club night however the rooms are soundproof so it's peaceful once upstairs. Apple TV and beautifully clean rooms, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: NoraSalonico
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a very quite street but in the middle of the New Berlin life:Oranienburger str (eat at Amrit indian restaurant, drink at Bellini lounge), Alte Schonhauser str (eat at Monsieur Vuong vietnamese restaurant), Hackesche Hofe (eat at Hasir turkish restaurant). S-Bahn and U-Bahn station very clost to the hotel.Beautiful crowd during all day, nice art galleries, trendy boutiques, countless cafes and restaurants-all nearby. The bed at the hotel was great and the sleep relaxed.I didn't have breakfast at the hotel but there are many places to have breakfast under and around the S-bahn station.Walking distance to AlexanderPlatz and Museum Island. Very kind girl at the reception desk!Strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: moffifox
Reviews.Content: What do people expect from a stay in a hotel whilst on holiday or away on business? Well these are the things I look for. Good helpful enthusiastic staff, good nights sleep in a comfortable bed and a restaurant and bar for a meal and a drink. Not a lot to ask? Well the Weinmeister failed on all these basic requirements. The staff should be flipping burgers at McDonald's. They had no idea or interest in what they where doing. A receptionist watched as I spent five minutes trying to use the coffee machine, dead behind the eyes. I attempted a meal in the evening and the waitress came over and said there weren't any menus. We spent fifteen minutes playing a game where I asked if she had steak and she said no! Pasta? No, Human meat? Err.............no! Just how dumb is that? The room was the size of a postage stamp and the bed took up 95% of it. Not bad. It was comfortable. The problem was I couldn’t sleep in it because of the noise. What hotel would use heavy, loud metal doors, a door that echoed around the whole hotel every time it was shut? Doors so loud they keep you awake all night. Then being on the 5th floor we where directly below the beauty spa. So every morning at 7am the sound of high heels and doors slamming started until my alarm went off. I checked out today and was greeted by a rude and very self-opinionated burger flipper who thought run the hotel (in essense, a jobsworth!!) who demanded my credit card even though I explained there where two company cards behind the reception. She demanded several times for a card, she mumbled, tutted and rolled her eyes and then looked me up and down as if I was a piece of crap. Nice. She called over her fay manager and I watched for several minutes as they talked in German about the situation and me. He talked to me like I was a piece of crap even though he was just the manager of this McDonalds restaurant. My passport was snatched off me and photocopied; I left my business card, signed and existed. The icing on the cake and a fine metaphor for the quality of the hotel and my stay. This hotel calls itself a design/boutique hotel. IT IS NOT. Any hotel that gives you a 10% discount card for Superdry is not cool and should be sued through the trades description act. The staff are rude and the food, we will never know. The best thing about the hotel? Free Internet. But I can get that for free at McDonalds and I’d get fed and I could probably get a better night sleep. If you have to stay in the Weinmeister good luck to you, my advice would be stay in the Hotel Casa next door it’s where we ate the night the Weinmeister had no menus!!!!! http://www.casacamper.com/berlin/default-de.html

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Innovative!”
Reviews.Author: doriis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very stylish with an amazing facade and an impressive interior . The room looks minimalistic , but I found it very comfy, especially the big bed. And the Apple iMac instead of television , is a great idea. The staff is always attentive . Very nice is also the Schwarz Bar , for sure the Schwarz drink. The location of the hotel is great, very near to the TV tower and the best bars and restaurants in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “This is my kind of boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antonio_em_Nairobi
Reviews.Content: Starting from the front door, which looks like the grafitti-tainted entrance of an underground techno-club (how typically Berliner), to the iMac 27" working station/TV set and the tendy guests lounging in the huge armchairs in the lobby, sipping Nespressos to the sound of minimal techno, everything is thought of to create that kind of innovative avant garde alternative ambiance that you look for when visiting the German cultural and political capital. Just steps away from the fashion design boutiques of Mulackstrasse and Kastanienallee, from the U-bahn station and a short cab ride from Tegel airport, it's location is ideal, right in the heart of upbeat Mitte. Staff was attentive to any detail that could make my stay pleasant, including a-la-carte breakfast and restaurant hints. I definitely will come back.

Reviews.Title: “trendy and cosy”
Reviews.Author: duke_clar
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good experience. Modern ambiance and very kind staff. It is a design hotel, not for those seeking a more standardized large-hotel-chain type of experience. Plus: - location is Mitte, central and urban trendy (shops, bars and restaurants) Subway < 50 meters distance - very kind and helpful staff. They performed well on our standard requests (cabs, booking restaurants, printing docs) - sleek contemporary design of lobby / room - room (booked the large one): stylish, quiet (it overlooked a nice courtyard), very clean, fairly large. We liked the huge / high dmf structure-bed (mattress very comfortable) though it takes up a lot of the available space. Excellent separate shower and a big tub right behind the bed add a very nice touch. - equipment: very good. iMac 27", free wifi for the portable devices, iPhone iPod speaker. Easy to operate (I am an average Mac user) - apparently frequented by smart travelers: no large groups or clueless customers trudging across with bulky luggage. Minus: - tv only in German, picture quality not great, changing channel slow (for us a minor quibble as we were in Berlin for pleasure) - no chair for the iMac to use it as a pc - we did not try breakfast but it does not seem comfortable to eat it in the lobby on the big sofa chairs, in any case there is an overwhelming number of trendy places around to have breakfast - duvet could be bigger to cover the entire width of the king size bed so as to avoid "fights" for quilts at night.

Reviews.Title: “Design Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: R0bdub
Reviews.Content: It ain't no Hilton. This is a dreadful place. The staff are surly, the design factor might look cool but nothing in this place is practical. ( Actually most of it isn't that cool either ). The breakfast is done on the cheap, I have had my bed linen changed once in the whole week I was here. You read it right, once in the whole week. The room is dangerously small, I'd go far as to say it's a potential fire hazard it's so small.( eg; you can only just barely step onto the floor from the bed on one side and not on the other.) I had to ask for bathroom soap and a cake of Palmolive was delivered a day later. I felt embarrassed for the hotel chamber maid to be honest. What a joke. And don't dare expect any English language TV stations or newspapers, how dare one be English speaking. What was I thinking. Not even CNN or BBC for us foreigners. A dreadful place, with dreadful staff and dreadful rooms. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Boutique/Design Hotel.... perfect for a romantic break”
Reviews.Author: ToriLang
Reviews.Content: As a design/boutique hotel I knew it would be different, and so I was expecting something amazing and I was not dissapointed. My boyfriend and I stayed for 2 nights. The Apple Mac computer in the rooms, allow free unlimited internet access and tv channels. Our shower was seperate from the rest of the bathroom - the design was very modern & stylish - but practical it was not, it took us a day to work out how to use the shower hose! The same with the bathroom sink plug, we couldn't work out how to undo it once it was down! The location of the hotel was perfect, about a 15-20 minute walk to the centre. The hotel staff were very friendly and spoke excellent english. The entrance to the hotel is somewhat different from the average hotel, what we thought was the glass-plated front entrance was actually the fire exit, what we thought was the graffiti-covered fire exit was the main entrance! Overall our time in the hotel was amazing, I would definitely recommend it and I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for vacation, not for work.”
Reviews.Author: Carl S
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, beautiful rooms with great facilities. Nice rooftop area. The bed was on the harder side... On the downside is the cost for innovative design, -lack of practicallity. We had a sofa and some footrest in the room, awkardly placed due to the enormous bed, no chair or workspace. The iMac is great but it is quite difficult to use it for anything else but watching tv since you can't sit in front of it. And I consider myself quite agile:-) I had some work to do and sat on the bed with my macbook instead. Besides that glitch everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Style Over Content”
Reviews.Author: LeedsEddie
Reviews.Content: Berlin has seen a vast number of hotel openings in recent years and I’ve stayed at a few in the Mitte district. This week was the turn of The Weinmeister Hotel conveniently located on Weinmester Strasse. Before reviewing the hotel I will preface my criticism by saying that the staff are lovely, friendly and speak excellent English for those that don’t speak German. If this hotel were located in New York you’d comfortably pay double and be grateful. What really annoys about this hotel however is the design. Here we have a throw back to the pre-crash days of ‘style over substance’. How does this manifest itself then? Well take the guest room; a generous black tiled shower room but somebody forgot to include any form of shelf on which to stand a shampoo bottle. The tv? Well it’s a beautiful looking Mac TV in seductive mat silver. The problem is it’s fiendishly complicated to actually call up a tv programme. I’m no Luddite; I’m writing this review on a MacBook Air, my phone is an i-Phone and I have an i-Pad at home so I kinda know how Macs work. Never the less I was unable to find out how to turn the so-called tv on/ off using the remote. When I did get tv using the mouse the picture quality was as poor as you’d have found in Mitte in the old DDR days. The Mac sits on a desk but don’t think you could actually do any useful work at it because the designer has seen fit not to provide you with anything as handy as a chair – no they rather think that you’ll find a hard brown cube of upholstered MDF a better proposition for you to sit on. The bed is also mounted on a monstrously high raft of upholstered MDF and is stylishly positioned so as to prevent your partner reaching his/her side of the bed without climbing over you. Oh and by the way the bed is equipped with what I can only describe as ‘horns’. Not sure why but I bet they serve no purpose. The lobby – bar- breakfast room must be an operational nightmare and I pity the poor staff. The small public area is divided into niches with sloping curved plasterboard walls in which sit high backed chairs. It need hardly be said that the chair heights don’t allow you to eat your breakfast comfortably given the designers ‘form’ in the guest room. The problem is that when you are sat in this forest of niche and chair that you can’t see anybody and they can’t see you. You’d die of thirst waiting for the coffee waitress to spot you and then reach you through the maze in the morning. Finally what is the tie in with Superdry all about? Staff wear Superdry shirts and on arrival the guest is presented with a discount voucher for the Superdry shop next door. What do I want with that? I can’t see the hotel demographic of creative/media business traveller and well off middle-aged couple rushing to claim their 10% off. I was long gone by the time the store opened anyway. Whatever next? A Bench voucher on arrival at the Adlon? Superdry is after all the London market stall brand that pretends to be Japanese. Perhaps then it is appropriate - in the land of style over content.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: hbsource
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend (she booked) and we were both really impressed by the hotel and the room. It's just cool. The bed was huge and luxurious, the decor was cool and the bathroom was fitted out properly. It was modern and characterful, not always an easy combination to pull off. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel so I can't rate it although it looked adequate rather than amazing. But then, we didn't have many great meals in Berlin (don't go to Germany for the food). The staff were friendly although they couldn't give us much good advice on the couple of occasions we asked them about stuff in the local area. The hotel loses a star for me because of the small and slightly airport-departure-lounge public areas and because it's not cheap. Overall, I would certainly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable, but fairly basic”
Reviews.Author: hmhmhm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May and paid an average of 95 euro per night (without breakfast) for the most basic room. The hotel is modern and clean. Yes, it's a 'design' hotel, which may put some people off, but we didn't find it too 'cool' or the people too 'posey'. Our bed was large and comfortable, but quite high - we literally had to climb into bed! It seems like some of the practical things in the room were sacrificed for design elements - for example, there were no wardrobes, only hooks (this didn't bother us as we didn't unpack our things during our stay). The iMac and free internet access were very helpful! The location isn't bad - we arrived at the main train station, took the subway to Alexanderplatz and walked to the hotel in about 10 minutes. The walk to Museumsinsel took longer, but was definitely do-able. Service was friendly and helpful - reception was happy to help us order taxis, print out itineraries, etc. For the rate we paid, I thought the hotel was very good value. Our stay was very enjoyable and we would be happy to stay here again. Tip 1: one thing that was strange with our room - the shower cubicle was separate to the bathroom and directly faced the bed! So while your roommate is showering, you could sit on the bed (or be practically anywhere else in the room) and, uh, watch! Friends of ours stayed in another room and said that their shower was also separate to the bathroom, but was tucked away in the corner of their room, rather than on display. So if you're a little more modest, I'd recommend that you specify you'd like a room that has a more discrete shower cubicle. Tip 2: if your room rate doesn't include breakfast, check out Strandbad Mitte (a few blocks away from the hotel on Kleine Hamburger Str. 16: www.strandbad-mitte.de/index.html) for breakfast (see photo attached). The hotel breakfast wasn't cheap and looked ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, classy”
Reviews.Author: Mill R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently and it was wonderful. My DJ agency set it up for me. I travel to Berlin often and it was fantastiche...super-clean and quiet rooms, right in the heart of the trendy Mitte district. Friendly staff, modern design, kind of minimal but daring, a bit like Villalobos. Free internet, computer in room, sexy sexy model photo on the wall that got me and my partner geil/ Auf gut Deutsch, it is just the best, just try it - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: 432ccdp
Reviews.Content: As earlier reviews are stated - bed overtakes the room and all very crowded even in double room. no fridge in room as they say room service 24/7 - which it is not unless you like reheated chilli con carne. breakfast overpriced and at a bar and again crowded. room - small, bathroom very small and toilet just behind bed head. area to sore clothing limited. overall, too small and crowded. Room had numerous marks over the walls where people had left luggage, giving a feeling that room not that well cared for. The hotel is trying to be too cool for school. Same price as 5 star hotels and does not deliver. Laundry service extortionate - same as the Kempinsk, also a day late in some cases so I had to wait ion Berlin for my laundry for 3 hours, not ideai. People come and knock on door at 8.30am to do room service even though there is a do not disturb sign and sometimes just walk in without knocking. Car Park - they charge you for without telling you at 25 Euros a day. Bottom line - would I stay there again, definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: wootie209
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a perfect quiet location, very close to Alexanderplatz, with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Room was spacious, bed was extremely comfy and having use of a mac in our room was very useful(look up restaurants, music etc). Loved the vibe of the hotel and area. Only downside was that there is no view from the hotel, we overlooked what seemed to be a disused building.

Reviews.Title: “Design Hotel with Intimacy”
Reviews.Author: AdventurerHamburg
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a pleasant experience and would return to the Weinmeister again Pros: - location in the middle of everything (lots of nice shops, Superdry flagship store and Absinth bar next door) - quiet though (room 601 seems to be the most perfect due to both the noise-free comfort and the view) -free Apple entertainment system (do not need to bring laptop with you) -very comfortable bed - very professional spa-therapist -rooftop bar on the 6th floor (book the room here if you are a smoker) -perfectly working air-conditioning - nice service-manager Cons: -typical Berlin service, very laid-back -the speed of service -the restaurant needs some improvement as it looks to be serving the purpose of breakfasts only -not all the food is available at the restaurant, though the one i tried was very tasty - it was not the cleanest room in my hotel experience, and yes at 8 am sharp the cleaning ladies are coming, so be sure to have a room far away from the elevator and floor entrance and put 'Do not Disturb' sign there And come on, with the average daily rate of 130 euros it is a steal even in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Speere
Reviews.Content: It looked much better than it was. Rooms are small with a huge bed taking most of the space as it's at the same time kind of a wardrobe. Staying in a double room with two people is a bit of a challenge. Reception staff at that time was very unfriendly and arrogant. We did not try the breakfast as the lobby is a bit depressing and Berlin offers fantastic breakfast places. Have stayed in much nicer design hotels than this one and would not come back even though the area is great. Parking in the garage is very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: lelibel
Reviews.Content: The Weinmeister is right in Mitte, probably the coolest district in Berlin, within walking distance of all the most interesting touristic sites. We loved the style and the concept: each part of the hotel is charming, well maintained and clean. Each room has an imac that can also be used as tv (offering free internet connection and some very useful tips as well). The huge bed and the shower were just amazing! Reception and bar's staff were extremely nice and polite and we really appreciate services and facilities they offered on site. Incredibly good value for money, we will definitely choose this hotel again for our next visit in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Well thought out and designed”
Reviews.Author: eawnyc
Reviews.Content: Located in the former East Berlin in a more residential, less touristy area of the city. However there is convenient access to the subways and trams making the location very convenient to other parts of the city. The rooms are well thought out with a seating area separate from the bed. Separate toilet area from the shower area makes it practical for two travelers. The rooftop is a great place to unwind after a long day. And, having computer access/wifi right in the room is an added plus. I just wish that after every guest leaves, that the hotel deletes the history of the previous room guests. Seeing the porn web addresses accessed previous to my room stay was a bit creepy and caused me pause with the cleanliness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to sleep”
Reviews.Author: 1822910Geert
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Berlin Mitte is within walking distance of Alexander Platz, Hackische Markt, the Spree and other touristic areas, it is a lively well off area , but then Berlin is lively all over... The hotel is quiet and clean, has a nice touch for those who like design, the blacklight behind the bed is a funny twist. I had a room with a good functioning spacey shower. The in-room Apple computer serves also as television, image quality was not terrific though, unfortunately the key board is not wire less and was very unpractical, There was no desk for the business traveler to do some last minute mails, thus reinstating the full use of laptop function of a laptop use. The roof top area could double as a nice bar but when i was there it was only a terras where you could drink the drinks you obtained in the bar on the ground floor. The staff was very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, great location but lacked a bit of substance in a couple of areas”
Reviews.Author: RachelStLondon
Reviews.Content: The Weinmeister is in a fantastic location - right in the middle of Mitte, the most happening part of Berlin, with great shops, restaurants and bars. Our room wasn't the biggest but it was really smartly kitted out with a huge comfortable bed, great bathroom and floor to ceiling windows. Downsides were that although the shower looks great it actually wasn't that practical. The Mac entertainment system was also promising but we struggled to get it working and the staff weren't able to help. Apart from that it was a great, very stylish hotel and good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Meisterhaft.”
Reviews.Author: Schleins Girl
Reviews.Content: The boyfriend and I stayed two nights at The Weinmeister Hotel. We occupied room 601, and liked the design throughout the hotel. The room had a nice size, big enough for the BIG bed and plenty of room around it. We loved the IMAC, with free internet access and TV in one, loved the bathroom and the view. The room was very cold due to draft from the big windows, but we just closed the curtains and worked the aircon. Maby it was due to the arctic weather outside. The breakfast was delicious, very healthy with yummy fresh fruits and juices. No danish pastry for the boyfriend. We have been to Berlin before, so we knew the location, and you should stay here in "Mitte", if you want to stay close to funky cafees, shops and restaurants. And I would recommend you to stay at The Weinmeister.

Reviews.Title: “wunderbar”
Reviews.Author: clairebear100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year period and I'll definitely be staying here again. Bizarrely, some reviewers have complained that the hotel is too cool, but what's wrong with cool? If you want traditional German interiors then this place isn't for you; it's modern, chic and still so shiny and new. Yes the rooms are small but well-designed and comfortable. It was an Arctic -18 outside but the rooms were always warm and cosy and the underfloor heating was a welcome treat. There's an imac in every room which proved incredibly useful in keeping my boyfriend entertained whilst I spent an excessive amount of time in the amazing shower. The staff were friendly and helpful - in fact, after my mentally challenged boyfriend left our bag in a Berlin cafe on New Year's Eve (containing my purse and phone) the hotel receptionist retrieved the bag and posted it back to the UK for us. The hotel is in a great location - right next to the underground and only a short walk away from Alexanderplatz. The only negative I can think of was the overpriced burger in the hotel lounge but apart from that the place was great.

Reviews.Title: “Had great stay, really liked the Design touch....”
Reviews.Author: Toolbag
Reviews.Content: Weinmeister hotel - great find from a recommendation from a friend, this funky well positioned hotel in Berlin Mitte is ideal for exploring all the main museum's that are in this part of town. Located on a quiet street, near local underground train link. Rooms are excellent, bathrooms super well designed with lots of wow factor. As mentioned in a previous review, public area is not huge, no real lounge area as such! So not a great hotel for hanging out in, more functional as a good place to sleep and have breakfast...not an issue if you are out and about anyway..

Reviews.Title: “RECEPTIONIST HANDSOME BUT RUDE/ ROOM SMALL, SMELLED PAINT”
Reviews.Author: XENIA1971
Reviews.Content: The view was the Tv Tower@Alex but also some employees from the buliding opposite the hotel. The ambience was kinda dead, I thought it would be fun for my teenager daughter to stay there, but we only saw 3 guests during our stay. The room is small, it smelled paint and my daughter became dizzy. Very new, very clean, rather cheap, next to the U Bahn Weinmeister, cinemas, restaurants etc. I think you should opt for the Camper hotel next door

Reviews.Title: “So cool it will never make it on a tripadvisor hot list.”
Reviews.Author: damian044
Reviews.Content: After a tough work trip to Amsterdam living out of our suitcases and looking foward to a relaxing stay in Berlin, what we encountered was unbelievable. We arrived at the front door and eventually found the reception which was been used as a bar counter for the guests of a magazine launch. We fought our way through the crowd to our room. So cool So hip at 40 I was lost, let me explain no wardrobe, no drawers, the new cool, leave your clothes in your suitcase for your 4 day stay. Nobody to show you the few gadgets, how to turn on lights etc, too busy serving the beautiful magazine people. Meant to stay for 4 nights, went to bed, hard as a rock,very uncomfortable, and then the workmen started at 7 am downstairs. The walls in the room are wafer thin we experienced a lot of noise internally and externally. Went downstairs at 9 am checked out of our large room, I would hate to see the small or medium rooms. We checked into another hotel, the staff of the Weismeister are too cool to help. Do not go by the website, no restaurant only a small bar with a very limited food offering. This hotel is an upmarket hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Painfully cool hotel in amazing neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: moaksey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We stayed here for a weekend in November and will definitely be coming back. Check-in was great. The staff are ultra-friendly and spoke better English than we did. The lobby/bar/restaurant area is very homey - although there isn't much floor space. The design is impressive as you come in - we missed the front door when walking past it the first time. The rooms are small - and the huge beds mean there is even less floor space - but you don't go to Berlin to hang out in a hotel room do you? The bed was SO comfortable. The linen was so fresh. The Mac TV is very functional (I'm a Mac user myself but never use mine as a TV). A jug of fresh water was provided in the evening which was a really nice touch. Pyjamas were provided too which are very comfortable - and another nice touch. The bathroom is small but the shower is great. Shower gel and shampoo was fantastic - a London brand but I can't remember which one. The neighbourhood the hotel is in is very cool - loads of small clothes shops, bars and restaurants. It is pretty much on top of Weinmasterstrasse Station which is very easy to get to on the subway. Alexanderplatz is a short walk too. I live in Dalston, London ("the coolest place on the planet" according to many) but this area beats it in many ways. There isn't too much more to say really as the hotel is so compact - which is great. I would give the hotel 10/10 and will absolutely go back and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hip friendly design hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: rwg1226
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of days at the Weinmeister recently and really enjoyed myself. The room was quiet even though it faced on the street and the unusual arrangement of having the bed be the central feature in the room with a bathtub behind it worked for me, but then I was alone. The room is not terribly large and I tripped over an upholstered cube placed at the foot of the bed, presumably so you could sit on it while tying your shoes? The bed, on the other hand, was quite comfortable. The location in Mitte would be hard to beat. The breakfast is OK, not the usual German buffet, but much cheaper that the usual buffet too. The staff spoke good English although they patiently endured my German when I told them I wanted to practice on them. I thought the staff was a group of genuinely friendly people and I enjoyed them alot. The one, mild, criticism I had was the quality of the food in the restaurant. I thought it would be better to concentrate on a more limited menu that the kitchen could handle. As it is, the menu is too extensive and the food tastes like it's prepared elsewhere and warmed up there. It wasn't truly bad, but it wasn't very good either. It was, however, relatively reasonably priced, especially for a hotel restaurant. I really appreciated the free internet, which had a good speed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location”
Reviews.Author: MRZS312
Reviews.Content: We have had generally great experience with any hotel that is part of the Design Hotel chain, and picked this one because it had the right combination of price and location (all other comparable hotels in the Mitte area were priced much higher). The staff was friendly enough at the front desk, although we had almost no contact with any other staff beyond the check-in process (there is a side door that allows you to bypass the lobby completely in order to access the elevator). The staff, however, was nice enough to offer us a room in the back of the hotel as construction was done out front (although we should point out we barely even noticed, since all the noise took place during the middle of the day while we were out sightseeing). While the rooms were rather small, they were beautifully designed and made excellent use of the space. The bathrooms were wonderfully appointed and the bed was very comfortable (even though it was encased in a giant plush headboard contraption which ate up most of the room space). The best feature of this hotel is the iMac in every room (with free internet access) put in place of a television – brilliant idea! This turned out to be an incredibly helpful feature, one that we wish more hotels would adopt. The location of the hotel was also perfect – smack in the middle of the mitte, nearby great shops, restaurants, and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Design treat”
Reviews.Author: davidinzurich
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit small but done with a distinct contemporary taste - the iMac as a media center in the room is great, and the shower gel is a special treat. Lots of creative ideas and great location in Mitte. Service is however not as hip as the place itself, and the breakfast is clearly below what you could expect from the rest of the place.

Reviews.Title: “High Design, not so functional, but still a great stay”
Reviews.Author: greenNYC
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers noted (in german), there are some issues with the Weinmeister. Yes, it's hard to find the entrance. I think this is exacerbated by the construction going on in the street out front as well. It was the construction workers who pointed us to the door, saving us from walking around the block with our luggage. I posted a picture here of the entrance, so you know what to look for! The staff at the Weinmeister were awesome. All friendly and helpful. The restaurant is a little odd, but that's what you get at a design hotel - something out of the ordinary. I think it's better as more of a lounge for meeting and munching, as opposed to going for a romantic dinner or the like. The location is awesome as far as restaraunts/galleries/shops go, so you shouldn't be hanging out at the hotel anyway... We had a standard room and got a really great deal (the "opening special"), so not sure what the rooms normally go for/value would be. The rooms are high on design, but low on function. I imagine it could be a little annoying if you were there for more than a few days - I was there for four nights, and it was okay. The rooms are very quiet and the bed is super comfy, which is a plus. The downside is that there's nowhere to hang your towel if you want to use it more than once, nowhere to put your soap/shampoos in the shower, nowhere to set up a couple of suitcases (except on the couch and chest) - little conveniences like those. Also mentioned in a previous review - the windows don't open. I had no issue with this. There's a thermostat to control your temperature, and one of the windows did open a few inches for fresh airflow, if needed... These are all things that can be balanced out by the friendly staff and the great location, though. It's no doubt a "trendy" "hip" hotel, so to that degree, you know what to expect a little. I'd definitely stay there again...that is if I can afford the normal, non-special rates... I should also note that I didn't see any dust or issues with construction/cleanliness when I was there, so perhaps that's wrapped up now.
